1 /**
  2  * @fileoverview
  3  * - Depends only on console.*
  4  * - modern browser MUST be supported. other may be supported
  5  * - TODO is the namespace name properly named
  6  *
  7  * Is it possible to detect anonymous function and to make give them a name
  8 */
  9 
 10 /**
 11  * @namespace
 12 */
 13 var debug	= {};
 14 
 15 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
 16 //		Implement queuable getter setter				//
 17 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
 18 
 19 /**
 20  * by default __defineGetter__ support only one function. Same for __defineSetter
 21  * This is a annoying limitation. This little library declares 2 functions
 22  * Object.__defineQGetter__ and Object.__defineQGetter__.
 23  * They behave the same as their native sibling but support multiple functions.
 24  * Those functions are called in the same order they got registered.
 25  * 
 26  * (I have no idea of the reasoning behind this limitation to one function. It seems
 27  *  useless to me. This remind me of onclick of the DOM instead of a proper .addEventListener) 
 28 */
 29 (function(){
 30 	/**
 31 	 * Class to implement queueable getter/setter
 32 	 * @param  {Object} baseObject The base object on which we operate
 33 	 * @param  {String} property   The string of property
 34 	 */
 35 	var _QueuableGetterSetter	= function(baseObject, property){
 36 		// sanity check 
 37 		console.assert( typeof(baseObject) === 'object' );
 38 		console.assert( typeof(property) === 'string' );
 39 		// backup the initial value
 40 		var initialValue= baseObject[property];
 41 		// init some local variables
 42 		var _this	= this;
 43 		this._getters	= [];
 44 		this._setters	= [];
 45 		// define the root getter
 46 		baseObject.__defineGetter__(property, function(){
 47 			var value	= baseObject['__'+property];
 48 			for(var i = 0; i < _this._getters.length; i++){
 49 				value	= _this._getters[i](value)
 50 			}
 51 			return value;
 52 		});
 53 		// define the root setter		
 54 		baseObject.__defineSetter__(property, function(value){
 55 			for(var i = 0; i < _this._setters.length; i++){
 56 				value	= _this._setters[i](value)
 57 			}
 58 			baseObject['__'+property] = value;
 59 		});
 60 		// set the initialValue
 61 		baseObject['__'+property]	= initialValue;
 62 	};
 63 	
 64 	//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
 65 	// Override prototype of global ```Object```
 66 	Object.prototype.__defineQGetter__	= function(property, getterFn){
 67 		var name	= "__dbgGetSet_" + property;
 68 		// init _QueuableGetterSetter for this property if needed
 69 		this[name]	= this[name] || new _QueuableGetterSetter(this, property);
 70 		// setup the new getter
 71 		this[name]._getters.push(getterFn)
 72 	};
 73 	
 74 	Object.prototype.__defineQSetter__	= function(property, setterFn){
 75 		var name	= "__dbgGetSet_" + property;
 76 		// init _QueuableGetterSetter for this property if needed
 77 		this[name]	= this[name] || new _QueuableGetterSetter(this, property);
 78 		// setup the new setter
 79 		this[name]._setters.push(setterFn)
 80 	};
 81 })();
 82 
 83 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
 84 //		misc								//
 85 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
 86 
 87 /**
 88  * Display a message every time the function is called
 89  * 
 90  * @param {Function} fn the original function
 91  * @param {String} [message] message to display when the function is called. Optional
 92  * @returns {Function} The modified function
 93 */
 94 debug.obsolete	= function(originalFn, message){
 95 	return function(){
 96 		console.warn(message || "Obsoleted function called. Please update your code.");
 97 		console.trace();
 98 		// forward the call to the original function
 99 		return fn.apply(this, arguments);
100 	}
101 }
102 
103 /**
104  * Wrap a function between 2 functions
105  * 
106  * @param {Function} originalFn the original function
107  * @param {Function} beforeFn the function to call *before* the original function
108  * @param {Function} afterFn the function to call *after* the original function
109  * @returns {Function} The modified function
110 */
111 debug.wrapCall	= function(originalFn, beforeFn, afterFn){
112 	return function(){
113 		var stopNow	= false;
114 		// call beforeFn if needed
115 		if( beforeFn )	stopNow = beforeFn(originalFn, arguments);
116 		// forward the call to the original function
117 		var result	= originalFn.apply(this, arguments);
118 		// call afterFn if needed
119 		if( afterFn )	afterFn(originalFn, arguments, result);
120 		// return the result
121 		return result;
122 	}
123 }
124 
125 /**
126  * Trigger the debugger when the function is called
127  *
128  * @param {Function} originalFn the original function
129  * @param {Function} [conditionFn] this function should return true, when the breakpoint should be triggered. default to function(){ return true; }
130  * @returns {Function} The modified function
131 */
132 debug.breakpoint	= function(fn, conditionFn){
133 	conditionFn	= conditionFn	|| function(){ return true; };
134 	return function(){
135 		var stopNow	= conditionFn();
136 		// if stopNow, trigger debugger
137 		if( stopNow === true )	debugger;
138 		// forward the call to the original function
139 		return fn.apply(this, arguments);
140 	}
141 }
142 
143 /**
144  * assert which actually try to stop the excecution
145  * if debug.assert.useDebugger is falsy, throw an exception. else trigger the
146  * debugger. It default to false
147  *
148  * @param {Boolean} condition the condition which is asserted
149  * @param {String} message the message which is display is condition is falsy
150  * @param {Boolean} [useDebugger] the condition which is asserted
151 */
152 debug.assert	= function(condition, message, useDebugger){
153 	if( condition )	return;
154 	if( debug.assert.useDebugger || useDebugger )	debugger;
155 	throw new Error(message	|| "assert Failed")
156 }
157 debug.assert.useDebugger	= false;
158 
159 /**
160  * extract a stacktrace. TODO make it work in node.js/chrome/firefox and modern browsers
161  * 
162  * @param {Integer} [nShift] number of calls to skip in the stacktrace 
163  * @returns {Array} array of object like {url: "http://*", line : 42, column: 12};
164 */
165 debug.stacktrace	= function(nShift){
166 	var createException	= function() {
167 		try{	this.undef();
168 		}catch( e ){
169 			return e;
170 		}
171 		return undefined;
172 	};
173 
174 	var e		= createException();
175 	var lines	= e.stack.split('\n');
176 	var descLine	= lines.shift();
177 	var locations	= [];
178 	lines.forEach(function(line){
179 		var matches	= line.match(/^\s+at\s+(.+):(\d+):(\d+)/);
180 		console.assert(matches.length === 4, "Parse error in line: "+line)
181 		locations.push({
182 			url	: matches[1],
183 			line	: parseInt(matches[2]),
184 			column	: parseInt(matches[3])
185 		});
186 	});
187 	// honor nShift
188 	nShift	= nShift !== undefined ? nShift : 0;
189 	for(var i = 0; i < nShift+2; i++)	locations.shift();
190 	// return the result
191 	return locations;
192 }
193 
194 
195 /**
196  * Same as __LINE__ in C
197 */
198 debug.__defineQGetter__('__LINE__', function(){
199 	var stacktrace	= debug.stacktrace();
200 	return stacktrace[2].line
201 });
202 
203 /**
204  * Same as __LINE__ in C
205 */
206 debug.__defineQGetter__('__FILE__', function(){
207 	var stacktrace	= debug.stacktrace();
208 	var url		= stacktrace[2].url;
209 	var basename	= url.match(/([^/]*)$/)[1]	|| ".";
210 	//console.log("stacktrace", stacktrace, "url", url, "basename", basename)
211 	return basename;
212 });
213 
214 
215 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
216 //		Function Attribute						//
217 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
218 
219 /**
220  * Function attribute builder
221 */
222 debug.fnAttr	= function(originalFn){
223 	return new debug.FnAttrClass(originalFn)
224 }
225 
226 debug.FnAttrClass	= function(originalFn){
227 	this._currentFn	= originalFn;
228 }
229 
230 debug.FnAttrClass.prototype.done	= function(){
231 	return this._currentFn;
232 }
233 
234 debug.FnAttrClass.prototype.obsolete	= function(message){
235 	this._currentFn	= debug.wrapCall(this._currentFn, function(){
236 		console.warn(message || "Obsoleted function called. Please update your code.");
237 		console.trace();
238 	});
239 	return this;	// for chained API
240 }
241 
242 debug.FnAttrClass.prototype.timestamp	= function(){
243 	this._currentFn	= debug.wrapCall(this._currentFn, function(){
244 		console.log("run at "+ new Date);
245 	});
246 	return this;	// for chained API
247 };
248 
249 debug.FnAttrClass.prototype.log		= function(message){
250 	this._currentFn	= debug.wrapCall(this._currentFn, function(){
251 		console.log(new Date+" Function Enter."+message);
252 	}, function(){
253 		console.log(new Date+" Function Leave."+message);
254 	});
255 	return this;	// for chained API
256 };
257 
258 debug.FnAttrClass.prototype.warn	= function(message){
259 	this._currentFn	= debug.wrapCall(this._currentFn, function(){
260 		console.warn(new Date+" Function Enter."+message);
261 	}, function(){
262 		console.warn(new Date+" Function Leave."+message);
263 	});
264 	return this;	// for chained API
265 };
266 debug.FnAttrClass.prototype.error	= function(message){
267 	this._currentFn	= debug.wrapCall(this._currentFn, function(){
268 		console.error(new Date+" Function Enter."+message);
269 	}, function(){
270 		console.error(new Date+" Function Leave."+message);
271 	});
272 	return this;	// for chained API
273 };
274 debug.FnAttrClass.prototype.time	= function(label){
275 	label	= label !== undefined ? label : "fnAttr().time()-"+Math.floor(Math.random()*9999).toString(36);
276 	this._currentFn	= debug.wrapCall(this._currentFn, function(){
277 		console.time(label)
278 	}, function(){
279 		console.timeEnd(label)
280 	});
281 	return this;	// for chained API
282 };
283 debug.FnAttrClass.prototype.profile	= function(label){
284 	label	= label !== undefined ? label : "fnAttr().profile()-"+Math.floor(Math.random()*9999).toString(36);
285 	this._currentFn	= debug.wrapCall(this._currentFn, function(){
286 		console.profile(label)
287 	}, function(){
288 		console.profileEnd(label)
289 	});
290 	return this;	// for chained API
291 };
292 
293 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
294 //		type checking							//
295 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
296 
297 /**
298  * Ensure that the property is never NaN
299  * Inspired from http://29a.ch/2011/10/20/javascript-fuck-nan-undefined by @29a_ch
300  * 
301  * @param {Object} baseObject the base object containing the property
302  * @param {String} property the property to check
303 */
304 debug.noNaN	= function(baseObject, property){
305 	baseObject.__defineQSetter__(property, function(value){
306 		console.assert(value === value, "property '"+property+"' is a NaN");
307 		return value;
308 	});
309 }
310 
311 /**
312  * Ensure the type of a variable with typeof() operator
313  * 
314  * @param {Object} baseObject the base object containing the property
315  * @param {String} property the property to check
316  * @param {String} typeofString the exepected result of typeof(property)
317 */
318 debug.checkTypeof	= function(baseObject, property, typeofStr){
319 	baseObject.__defineQSetter__(property, function(value){
320 		debug.assert(typeof(value) === typeofStr, "property typeof('"+property+"') === '"+typeof(value)+"' (instead of '"+typeofStr+"')");
321 		return value;
322 	});
323 };
324 
325 /**
326  * Ensure the type of a variable with instanceof
327  * 
328  * @param {Object} baseObject the base object containing the property
329  * @param {String} property the property to check
330  * @param {Object} klass the expected class
331 */
332 debug.checkInstanceof	= function(baseObject, property, klass){
333 	baseObject.__defineQSetter__(property, function(value){
334 		// TODO add a link toward the origin error
335 		debug.assert(value instanceof klass, "property "+property+" not of proper class");
336 		return value;
337 	});
338 };
339 
340 /**
341  * Ensure the type of a variable using typeof or instanceof depending on klass
342  * 
343  * @param {Object} baseObject the base object containing the property
344  * @param {String} property the property to check
345  * @param {Object} klass the expected class
346 */
347 debug.checkType	= function(baseObject, property, klass){
348 	if( klass === Number ){
349 		debug.checkTypeof(baseObject, property, 'number');
350 	}else if( klass === String ){
351 		debug.checkTypeof(baseObject, property, 'string');
352 	}else{
353 		debug.checkInstanceof(baseObject, property, klass);		
354 	}
355 };
356 
357 /**
358  * Ensure the type of a variable with typeof() operator
359  * 
360  * @param {Object} baseObject the base object containing the property
361  * @param {String} property the property to check
362  * @param {function} callback the function called the property is set
363 */
364 debug.checkValueRange	= function(baseObject, property, callback){
365 	baseObject.__defineQSetter__(property, function(value){
366 		console.assert(callback(value) === true, "property '"+property+"' got invalid value. >"+value+"<");
367 		return value;
368 	});
369 };
370 
371 // export the namespace in node.js - if running in node.js
372 if( typeof(window) === 'undefined' )	module.exports	= debug;
373
